tips.header: 1. Make sure your lifestyle is suitable for a cat
tips.description: You should know that you have the time to devote to a cat as well as having enough money to be able to afford necessities for yout cat.
It is extremely important that your cat is healthy and finding the right veterinarian is key.

tips.header: 3. Make a space for your cat
tips.description: Adjusting to a new home can be very difficult for a cat but allowing for a space that is just for the cat to feel safe can help them a lot.

playing with your cat is an important bonding experince that can bring you and your cat closer together. It also allows for your cat to get physical exercise which will help them maintain a healthy weight.
Cats love being able to observe their surroundings. Allowing for your cat to look outside will be very benefical towards their happiness.
While cats are usually capable of doing this themselves, grooming removes excess fur, prevents matting, and reduces shedding.
Every cat is unique so its important to learn about their breed, any health concerns, behavior with other animals, and any history of trauma/neglect.
Most cats require a specific diet depending on their age, allergies, or health conditions. Consult a veterinarian for a specific diet.
While similar to playing, ensure you take time to take breaks with your cat outside of play.
Cats surprisingly like watching TV, especially videos of birds, fish, or mice and any other animals they like to stalk.

facts.description: 1. If a cat blinks slowly at you, it means they love you!
2. The average cat sleeps for 16-18 hours per day.
4. The oldest known pet cat existed 9,500 years ago.
5. In 1963 a cat went to space.
